title: How to import sessions from SecureCRT or any other application?
author: q9HugW
body_snippet: Hi, I would like to import sessions from SecureCRT but I don't know how to do it and there's no help on Google at all. Please feel free to let me know if you require any further information. Thank you!

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
General import Documentation is here: https://mremoteng.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_interface/import_export.html

Though for SecureCRT there is not yet an official importer. For MobaXTerm see #1431.

comments.author: q9HugW
comments.snippet:
> General import Documentation is here: https://mremoteng.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_interface/import_export.html
> 
> Though for SecureCRT there is not yet an official importer. For MobaXTerm see #1431.

Is there any other tool we support other than MobaXTerm? I can import SecureCRT sessions into those tools and import back into mRemoteNG.
I don't have MobaXTerm license so I can't import SecureCRT into MobaXterm, it has session limitation.

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
Apart of mRemoteNG XML and CSV files it can also import RDP and RDG files: 
![image](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/assets/33432894/e31d6aba-2a0c-40be-aa96-cff7b0bcaf60).

All others would need to be converted manually / with a custom script. And I only know of MobaXTerm which got the custom script done so far.

comments.author: q9HugW
comments.snippet:
> Apart of mRemoteNG XML and CSV files it can also import RDP and RDG files: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33432894/264437945-e31d6aba-2a0c-40be-aa96-cff7b0bcaf60.png).

All SecureCRT's sessions are configuration files and does not belong to any of these formats in the image.
I thought I can import into Putty but it's not working.

> All others would need to be converted manually / with a custom script. And I only know of MobaXTerm which got the custom script done so fa...

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: where is an idea to create a separate tool what allow users to create they own schemas to import/export settings at this moment such functionality is not implemented.
